title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: So I have on the bench an 820-2936 tonight and It has me stumped. With board only out on the table, when I plug in a MS I get no PP3V42 but has a light, PPBUS_G3H is 2.6V. On U6990 I'm getting 18v on pins 4 & 7, but no PP3V42_G3H. I replaced U6990 and at first it seemed to work, had MS light, PP3V42 was present as well as PPBUS. After a few min I tried to turn it back on and nothing. Just a fading green light. It seemed like I fixed it but not back to not working. I tried to trigger SMC_ON/OFF_L but nothing happened.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message:
Post the actual voltage for 3V42_G3H and PPBUS_G3H.
Also check for 3V3_S5/SUS.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message:
PP3V42_G3H: 0V
PPBUS_G3H: 2V
3V3_S5: 0V
3V3_SUS: 0V

Also, The magsafe light fades after about 35 seconds.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message:
18V steady at F6905?
If yes, post U6990 and U7000 voltages.
If not, change Q7080.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: I have 18V on both pins of F6905.  Will create another post of voltages for U6990 and U7000.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Diode mode to ground at L6995?

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message:
Change again U6990 and be sure to get good solders.
Check all traces in the area.
If needed, change C6991/96 too.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: changed U6990 twice, same result. will change caps next. tricky area being next to ram slot.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Ok, changed C6991/C996 and still same.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: So weird. I got PP3V42 and PPBUS to show up for a min, then it went away again. Also, the magsafe light fades away until I turn off then turn back on the power supply. Even when they showed up temporarily, no fan spin. I'm wondering if maybe something is pulling it down. Or if the SMC is bad.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Input voltage at U6990 is stable?

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: yes. I wonder if I need to order some new U6990 ICs vs pulling them from donor.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Be sure to have good traces and solders first.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Confirmed all pins around U6990 are connected to the vias around it and touched up solder joints. What other components around it could influence it not to put out PP3V42_G3H?

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message:
This chip doesn't have an external feedback network.
Replace R6995, just in case.
Try another L6995 too.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: ok

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Replaced those and no change

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: This board sucks. But I want to figure out what is wrong so I can document it.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Post again U6990 voltages and diode mode to ground at L6995.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: So I found something out, When I put my red multimeter probe on Pin 9 of U6990 and hook up charger, I get a pulse of PP3V42_G3H rail. SO that tells me the chip is trying to put 3.42V out but something is stopping it.

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: Did you change L6995 too?

title: 820-2936 No power, weird issue
message: I did. It is fixed. There was a broken via right above Q7810 (3V3S5_VFB_R7270). Ran a wire from R7270 into a via to L7220 and now have a working machine. Holy smokes this was a tough board. But it is back in the chassis and running Sierra like a champ.
